_comment: Created by EFisher on 26/03/2014 17:22:55 using v2.1
title: How does carer quality of life vary by age group?
analysis_commentary: We can see that carer-reported quality of life does vary by age group. Adults aged 18 to 64 report a lower quality of life score of 7.8, this is 0.5 lower than adults aged 65 and over who score 8.3.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Personal Social Services Survey of Adult Carers in England
